data.title: Illuminated Fountain Performances Playlists
data.text:
Check out our descriptions and playlists for this year’s Illuminated Fountain Performances. Revisit a favorite ... try something new* ... experience them all!

Bailando: Latin Rhythms

Be Our Guest

Bollywood Blockbusters

Come As You Are: ‘90s

Country Roads

Freedom

*Gershwin Favorites

*Get Back: The Beatles

Halloween Magic

Here You Come Again

Hip Hop Mixtape

*Italian Spectacular

It’s Always Sunny at Longwood Gardens

Las Vegas Legends

Leading Ladies: Madonna and Lady Gaga

The Magic of Mozart

Night at the Movies II

The Piano Men

Proud

Pure Imagination

Rachmaninov: Power and Passion

Romeo and Juliet

Shake It Off: Taylor Swift

The Show Must Go On

Sleeping Beauty

*Someone Like You: Artists Who Inspired Adele

*Spark Your Imagination

Starman: David Bowie

Swan Lake

Take the A Train to Birdland

*Take Me With U: Inspired by Prince

To Infinity and Beyond

We’ve Got the Funk

Where the Heart Is

Bailando: Latin Rhythms

August 15

Our fountains dance along to energetic Latin beats hailing from Mexico to Spain, courtesy of songs by Carlos Santana, Ricky Martin, and more.

José Alfredo Jiménez: El Rey

A Dios Le Pido: Juanes

Joan Sebastian: Secreto De Amor

Thalía: Pena Negra

Ricky Martin: Vente Pa’ Ca

Carlos Santana: Smooth

Enrique Iglesias: Bailando

Luis Fonsi and Daddy Yankee: Despacito

Shakira: Nunca Me Acuerdo de Olvidarte

Marc Anthony: Vivir Mi Vida

Return to top

Be Our Guest

September 7

Themes from your favorite animated movie classics—including Frozen, The Lion King, The Little Mermaid, and more—delight the young, and young at heart, during this magical performance.

When You Wish Upon a Star from Pinocchio

Try Everything from Zootopia

How Far I’ll Go from Moana

Under the Sea from The Little Mermaid

When We’re Human from The Princess and the Frog

Supercalifragilisticexpialidocious/Step in Time/Let’s Go Fly a Kite from Mary Poppins

Be Our Guest from Beauty and the Beast

Circle of Life from The Lion King

Let It Go from Frozen

Beauty and the Beast (Finale)

Return to top

Bollywood Blockbusters

August 29, October 25

Experience the vibrancy and beat of Bollywood as we celebrate the art and soul of Hindi film.

Asha Bhosle: Thodasa Pagla

Pradeep, Singh Sran, Nakash Aziz: Cutiepie

Arijit Singh, Antara Mitra: Gerua

Alka Yagnik, Javed: Chalka Chalka

Shankar, Ehsaan, Loy, Sonu Nigam: Kal Ho Naa Ho

Kavita Krishnamurthy, Shreya Ghoshal, KK: Dola Re Dola

Shankar, Eshaan, Loy, Sunkwinder Singh, Jaspinder Narula, Gulzar: Bunty Aur Babli

Return to top

Come as You Are: ‘90s

August 24

Take a ‘90s rewind with an eclectic mix from grunge to pop to one-hit wonders that defined the decade.

Nirvana: Come as You Are

Deee-Lite: Groove is in the Heart

The Proclaimers: I’m Gonna Be (500 Miles)

The Cranberries: Dreams

K.W.S.: Please Don’t Go

MC Hammer: U Can’t Touch This

Depeche Mode: Enjoy the Silence

Chumbawamba: Tubthumping

Return to top

Country Roads

No more performances this year

Take us home, country roads, with selections by Kenny Chesney, John Denver, Reba McEntire, and more country superstars.

Zac Brown Band: Homegrown

Eric Church: Heart On Fire

Shania Twain: Man! I Feel Like a Woman!

Kenny Chesney: Summertime

John Denver: Take Me Home, Country Roads

Johnny Cash: Folsom Prison Blues

Lady A: Like A Lady

Mickey Guyton: Lay It On Me

Reba McEntire: Fancy (Dave Audé Remix)

Return to top

Freedom

August 9

In honor of Juneteenth, this tribute to the end of slavery in the United States honors and recognizes the themes of freedom, hope, and strength.

Nina Simone: I Wish I Knew How It Would Feel To Be Free

Curtis Mayfield: Move On Up

The Staple Singers: Freedom Highway

Marvin Gaye: What’s Going On

Aretha Franklin: Respect

L.E.A.H: Ain’t Gonna Let Nobody

Sam Cooke: A Change is Gonna Come

Black Eyed Peas: Where is the Love?

Beyoncé and Kendrick Lamar: Freedom

Beyoncé: Lift Every Voice and Sing

Return to top

*Gershwin Favorites

August 1, September 12, October 10

New this year! Enjoy a moving selection of Gershwin’s beloved hits, including a celebration of the 100th anniversary of perhaps his best-known work: the jazz-inspired, revolutionary Rhapsody in Blue.

Judy Garland: I Got Rhythm

Chicago Symphony Orchestra: Cuban Overture

Kathleen Battle: Summertime

Chicago Symphony Orchestra: Rhapsody in Blue

Return to top

*Get Back: The Beatles

August 16, September 13, October 5

New this year! Celebrate the 60th anniversary of one of the most memorable musical moments of Yesterday: The Beatles’ first live performance in the US, appearing on The Ed Sullivan Show.

I Saw Her Standing There

Get Back

Magical Mystery Tour

Across the Universe

Yesterday

Come Together

Eleanor Rigby

We Can Work It Out

Golden Slumbers

Carry That Weight

The End

Hello, Goodbye

Return to top

Halloween Magic

October 26

You’re in for a real treat! Get ready for a spooky good time as our fountains dance along to spook-tacular Halloween favorites.

The Citizens of Halloween: This is Halloween

Sha Na Na: Witch Doctor

Fifth Harmony: I’m in Love with a Monster

The Lovin’ Spoonful: Do You Believe in Magic

Ray Parker Jr.: Ghostbusters

Warren Zevon: Werewolves of London

Stevie Wonder: Superstition

Michael Jackson: Thriller

Return to top

Here You Come Again

July 27, October 12

From 9 to 5 to Jolene, our fountains twirl along to powerhouse hits by cultural icon Dolly Parton.

Romeo (featuring Billy Ray Cyrus, Tanya Tucker, and Mary Chapin Carpenter)

Not Enough (featuring Queen Latifah)

I Will Always Love You

Islands in the Stream (featuring Kenny Rogers)

Jolene

Here You Come Again

Baby I’m Burnin’

Why’d You Come in Here Lookin’ Like That

From Here to the Moon and Back (featuring Kris Kristofferson)

9 to 5

Return to top

Hip Hop Mixtape

August 17

We pay homage to the powerhouse culture and expression of hip hop with a lively selection of favorites.

The Sugarhill Gang: Rapper’s Delight

DJ Kool: Let Me Clear My Throat

The Roots, Tariq Trotter, and Erykah Badu: You Got Me

Jay-Z and Alicia Keys: Empire State of Mind

Arrested Development: Mr. Wendal

Nas: I Can

Lizzo and Ariana Grande: Good As Hell

The Notorious B.I.G.: Mo Money Mo Problems

Return to top

*Italian Spectacular

October 17

New this year! From the trumpet fanfares of Monteverdi, to the lush melodies of Puccini, to the overwhelming grandeur of Respighi, celebrate the stunning musical legacy of Italy.

Monteverdi: Toccata from Orfeo

Respighi: St. Michael Archangel from Church Windows

Respighi: The Trevi Fountain at Midday from The Fountains of Rome

Respighi: The Birth of Venus from Three Botticelli Pictures

Respighi: La Befana from Roman Festivals

Puccini: Nessun dorma! from Turandot

Respighi: Pines Near a Catacomb from The Pines of Rome

Respighi: Pines of the Janiculum from The Pines of Rome

Respighi: Pines of the Appian Way from The Pines of Rome

Return to top

It’s Always Sunny at Longwood Gardens

September 26

The forecast calls for exuberant fountains that will have you Walking on Sunshine for this weather-inspired show.

Electric Light Orchestra: Mr. Blue Sky

Katrina & The Waves: Walking on Sunshine

Eurythmics: Here Comes the Rain Again

Imagine Dragons: Thunder

The Beatles: Good Day Sunshine

Johnny Nash: I Can See Clearly Now

Violent Femmes: Blister in the Sun

Smash Mouth: Walkin’ on the Sun

The Temptations: I Wish it Would Rain

The Weather Girls: It’s Raining Men

Return to top

Las Vegas Legends

No more performances this year

From the croons of the Rat Pack to the tunes of quintessential Vegas residency artists, it’s a sure bet there’s plenty of swagger in this stunning show.

Cher: Believe

Dean Martin: That’s Amore

Elvis Presley: Burning Love

Wayne Newton: Danke Schoen

Tom Jones: It’s Not Unusual

Blue Man Group: The Forge

Barry Manilow: Copacabana (At the Copa)

Frank Sinatra: That’s Life

Celine Dion: I Drove All Night

Elvis Presley: Viva Las Vegas

Return to top

Leading Ladies: Madonna and Lady Gaga

October 4

Vogue along to this thrilling show dedicated to pop icons and powerhouse influencers Madonna and Lady Gaga.

Madonna: Material Girl

Lady Gaga: Marry the Night

Madonna: Crazy for You

Lady Gaga: Stupid Love

Madonna: Like a Prayer

Lady Gaga: Bad Romance

Madonna: Vogue

Lady Gaga: Born This Way

Return to top

The Magic of Mozart

August 8

In a tribute to Mozart’s genius, our fountains glide along to selections from some of his most well-known masterpieces.

The Marriage of Figaro - Sinfonia

Divertimento in D - Presto

Symphony No. 35 - Finale

Requiem - Dies Irae

Requiem - Lacrimosa

Symphony No. 40 - Finale

The Magic Flute – Queen of the Night aria

The Magic Flute – Pa-Pa-Pa-Papagena

Symphony No. 41 - Molto Allegro

Return to top

Night at the Movies II

No more performances this year

Enjoy a lineup of silver screen hits from The Greatest Showman, Footloose, Aladdin, and more.

I Will Follow Him from Sister Act

Footloose from Footloose

Time Warp from The Rocky Horror Picture Show

Jai Ho from Slumdog Millionaire

A Million Dreams from The Greatest Showman

Friend Like Me from Aladdin

(I’ve Had) The Time of My Life from Dirty Dancing

This Is Me from The Greatest Showman

Return to top

The Piano Men

No more performances this year

From Tiny Dancer to My Life, our fountains sway to the iconic sounds of two of the greatest artists of all time—Billy Joel and Elton John.

Billy Joel: Prelude/Angry Young Man

Elton John: I’m Still Standing

Billy Joel: My Life

Elton John: Tiny Dancer

Billy Joel: Piano Man

Elton John: Saturday Night’s Alright for Fighting

Return to top

Proud

August 23

We’re beyond Proud to honor just a few of the many inspiring women in music, and their messages of strength and empowerment.

Heather Small: Proud

Kygo and Whitney Houston: Higher Love

Jennifer Lopez: Let’s Get Loud

Fleur East: Sax

Laura Mvula: That’s Alright

Andra Day: Rise Up

Rihanna: Don’t Stop the Music

MOMOLAND: Ready or Not

Return to top

Pure Imagination

August 3

You’ll be saying I’m a Believer with us in this imaginative show that takes you Over the Rainbow and into pure Magic.

Gene Wilder: Pure Imagination from Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory

The Monkees: I’m a Believer

Selena Gomez: Magic

Grace Potter: Something That I Want

Shawn Mendes: Imagination

Israel Kamakawiwo’ole: Over the Rainbow

DJ Khaled and Demi Lovato: I Believe

American Authors: Best Day of My Life

Swedish Mafia: Save the World

Ester Dean: Let It Grow (Celebrate the World)

Return to top

Rachmaninov: Power and Passion

September 19

Our fountains sway and dance along to the rich harmonies and lively fanfare of Rachmaninov’s Symphony No. 2, one of his best-known and most-loved compositions.

Symphony No. 2 in E minor, Op. 27

II. Allegro molto (A minor)

III. Adagio (A major)

IV. Allegro vivace (E major)

Return to top

Romeo and Juliet

August 22

It’s a love story for the ages as the sounds of Prokofiev’s ballet meet our dancing fountains.

Montagues and Capulets

Dance of Five Couples

Folk Dance

Dance of the Mandolins

Balcony Scene

Festivities Continue

Masques

Death of Juliet

Death of Tybalt

Return to top

Shake It Off: Taylor Swift

No more performances this year

Calling all Swifties: meet us in the Main Fountain Garden for a Love Story evening where fountains soar and Sparks Fly along to such hits as Look What You Made Me Do to Our Song and more.

Our Song

Blank Space

Love Story

You’re On Your Own, Kid

Paper Rings

Look What You Made Me Do

Red

Sparks Fly

Shake It Off

Return to top

The Show Must Go On

July 26

Give your regards to Broadway with these star-studded numbers sure to steal the show.

Pippin: Magic To Do

Dear Evan Hansen: Waving Through a Window

Dream Girls: And I Am Telling You I’m Not Going

Hamilton: You’ll Be Back

My Fair Lady: I Could Have Danced All Night

Six: No Way

Kinky Boots: Raise You Up/Just Be

Return to top

Sleeping Beauty

September 5

We awaken Tchaikovsky’s Sleeping Beauty for a beautiful evening beyond your wildest dreams.

Introduction

The Spell

Blind Man’s Bluff

The Spell Finale

Coda

The Christening Finale

Diamond Fairy & Coda

Hop-o’-My Thumb

Panorama

Lilac Fairy Variation

Coda

Polonaise

Apotheosis

Waltz

The Awakening

Return to top

*Someone Like You: Artists Who Inspired Adele

September 27, October 18

New this year! Say Hello to a captivating soundtrack of such hits as Someone Like You and Rolling in the Deep, woven together with the powerhouse sounds of Adele’s influences.

Adele: Hello

Adele: Easy On Me

Lauryn Hill: Can’t Take My Eyes Off of You

Alicia Keys: Girl On Fire

Adele: Someone Like You

Mary J. Blige: Family Affair

Adele: Set Fire to the Rain

Dusty Springfield: You Don’t Have To Say You Love Me

Adele: Rolling in the Deep

Return to top

*Spark Your Imagination

October 24

New this year! Spark Your Imagination with a show that will surely elicit a sense of wonder, awe, and excitement, featuring eclectic selections from emerging and established indie artists including Coldplay, Florence + The Machine, The Cranberries, and more.

M83: Midnight City

Paloma Faith: Upside Down

Florence + The Machine: Dog Days Are Over

The Cranberries: Just My Imagination

Superhuman, Quigley: Pure Imagination

Bastille: Pompeii

Woodkid: Run Boy Run

Sheppard: Geronimo

Coldplay: A Sky Full of Stars

Return to top

Starman: David Bowie

September 6

From Modern Love to Let's Dance, surround yourself in the unique sound and boundless creativity of David Bowie with this spectacular performance.

Modern Love

Young Americans

Starman

Life on Mars?

Changes

Suffragette City

Heroes

Let’s Dance

Return to top

Swan Lake

July 25

Tchaikovsky’s beloved ballet takes new flight in our graceful rendition of this poignant story of metamorphosis, romance, and tragedy.

Act I

Scène (Allegro giusto)

Waltz (Tempo di valse)

Pas de Trois (Allegro)

Pas de Trois Coda (Allegro vivace)

Pas de Deux (Tempo di valse)

Pas de Deux Coda (Allegro molto vivace)

Act II

Scène (Moderato)

Waltz (Tempo di valse)

Coda (Allegro vivace)

Act III

Scène (Allegro; Allegro giusto)

Spanish Dance (Allegro non troppo; Tempo di bolero)

Hungarian Dance; Czardas (Allegro moderato; Presto)

Act IV

Finale - Scène (Allegro vivace; Andante; Allegro agitato; Alla breve; Moderato e maestoso; Memo mosso; Moderato)

Return to top

Take the A Train to Birdland

September 14: Available to Wine & Jazz Festival Ticketholders Only

Find yourself in the famed New York jazz club as our fountains bop and swing along to Dizzy Gillespie, Ella Fitzgerald, Duke Ellington, and more jazz legends.

Ella Fitzgerald and Duke Ellington: Take the A Train

Dizzy Gillespie: Bang Bang

Louis Jordan: Is You Is or Is You Ain’t My Baby

Arturo Sandoval: Be-Bop

Nina Simone: Mood Indigo

Jazzmeia Horn: Out The Window

Oscar Peterson and Clark Terry: Mumbles

Buddy Rich: Birdland

Return to top

*Take Me With U: Inspired by Prince

August 31, September 20, October 19

New this year! Party like it's 1999 while reveling in the legacy and far-reaching influence of icon and innovator Prince, from his own hits to the songs of artists he inspired.

Prince: Take Me With U

The Weeknd: Blinding Lights

Prince: Kiss

The Chemical Brothers, featuring Beck: Skipping Like a Stone

Prince: When Doves Cry

St. Vincent: Fast Slow Disco

Prince: 1999

Return to top

To Infinity and Beyond

October 11

Beloved songs from animated movie favorites—from Encanto to Moana to Toy Story to many more—jump off the big screen in this delightfully fun family performance.

You’ve Got a Friend in Me from Toy Story

You’re Welcome from Moana

Nobody Like U from Turning Red

I Just Can’t Wait to be King from The Lion King

Into the Unknown from Frozen II

Three of Us from Monster High: The Musical

Hawaiian Roller Coaster Ride from Lilo & Stitch

Could Have Been Me from Sing 2

We Don’t Talk About Bruno from Encanto

Remember Me from Coco

Can’t Stop the Feeling from Trolls

Return to top

We’ve Got the Funk

September 21

From Prince to the Commodores to Parliament, we’ll be gathered together to all Let’s Go Crazy during this fun evening of funk.

Sly & The Family Stone: Thank You (Falettinme Be Mice Elf Agin)

The Isley Brothers: It’s Your Thing

Lyn Collins: Think (About It)

Commodores: Brick House

Parliament: Flashlight

War: Why Can’t We Be Friends?

Earth, Wind & Fire: Serpentine Fire

Prince: Let’s Go Crazy

Return to top

Where the Heart Is

August 2

Who says you can’t go home again? Cozy up to these feel-good, coming-home hits by Bon Jovi, Ed Sheeran, and more.

Edward Sharpe & The Magnetic Zeros: Home

Ed Sheeran: Castle on the Hill

David Byrne: Everybody’s Coming to My House

Jack Johnson: Home

Phillip Phillips: Home

Nina Simone: I’m Going Back Home

Billy Joel: You’re My Home

Bon Jovi: Who Says You Can’t Go Home

Return to top
